title: Design and Optimization of MOOC Experiences Using Learning Analytics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational scientific theories and experimental methodologies
context.additional_context: Students engage in a blended approach of online learning with personal devices and in-person discussions, with summative assessments measuring learning outcomes. Requires data-driven, personalized instructional design through learning analytics.

learning_goals: Learners can classify and explain learner engagement patterns into three types using learning analytics tools.
Learners can design online content structures tailored to the characteristics of each learner type.
Learners can implement a feedback system based on learning data to reduce learner dropout rates by 20%.

Within six months, learners develop an algorithm using Python and machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow) that recommends personalized learning paths (suggested lectures, review topics, difficulty adjustments) with over 80% accuracy from learning analytics data (progress rates, quiz scores, time spent) and achieve over 75% prediction accuracy on a test dataset.

resources: LMS (Learning Management System) Data Integration Tool

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
